factoid: Princess Mary entered her father's room.
Princess Mary went up to her father's bed.
The prince was lying on his back propped up high.
The prince had small bony hands with knotted purple veins.
The prince's hands were lying on the quilt.
The prince's left eye gazed straight ahead.
The prince's right eye was awry.
The prince's brows were motionless.
The prince's lips were motionless.
The prince seemed thin, small, and pathetic.
The prince's face seemed shriveled or melted.
The prince's features had grown smaller.
Princess Mary went up and kissed the prince's hand.
The prince's left hand pressed Princess Mary's hand.
The prince's left hand pressing Princess Mary's hand indicated he had long been waiting for her.
The prince twitched Princess Mary's hand.
The prince's brows and lips quivered angrily.
Princess Mary looked at the prince in dismay.
Princess Mary tried to guess what the prince wanted of her.
Princess Mary changed her position so that the prince's left eye could see her face.
The prince calmed down after Princess Mary changed her position.
The prince did not take his eyes off Princess Mary for some seconds.
The prince's lips and tongue moved.
The prince made sounds.
The prince began to speak.
The prince gazed timidly at Princess Mary.
The prince implored Princess Mary.
The prince appeared afraid that Princess Mary might not understand.
Princess Mary looked at the prince while straining all her faculties.
The prince's comic tongue movements made Princess Mary drop her eyes.
The prince's tongue movements made Princess Mary attempt to repress sobs.
The prince said something repeatedly.
The prince repeated the same words several times.
The prince repeated 'Mmm...ar...ate...ate...' several times.
The sounds the prince made were quite impossible to understand.
The doctor inquired, 'Mary, are you afraid?'
The prince shook his head.
The prince repeated the same sounds again.
Princess Mary questioned, 'My mind, my mind aches?'
The prince made a mumbling sound in confirmation.
The prince took Princess Mary's hand.
The prince began pressing Princess Mary's hand to different parts of his breast.
The prince pressed Princess Mary's hand as if trying to find the right place.
The prince uttered, 'Always thoughts... about you... thoughts...' more clearly.
Princess Mary pressed her head against the prince's hand.
Princess Mary tried to hide her sobs and tears.
The prince moved his hand over Princess Mary's hair.
The prince said, 'I have been calling you all night...'
Princess Mary said, 'If only I had known...'
Princess Mary said, 'I was afraid to come in.'
The prince pressed Princess Mary's hand.
The prince asked, 'Weren’t you asleep?'
Princess Mary answered, 'No, I did not sleep.'
Princess Mary shook her head.
Princess Mary tried to express herself by signs.
Princess Mary's tongue moved with difficulty.
Princess Mary could not quite make out what the prince had said.
The prince had uttered a tender caressing word.
The prince had never used that tender caressing word before.
The prince was silent for a while.
The prince said, 'Thank you... daughter dear!... for all, for all... forgive!... thank you!... forgive!... thank you!...'
Tears began to flow from the prince's eyes.
The prince said, 'Call Andrew!' suddenly.
The prince displayed a childish, timid expression of doubt.
The prince was aware his demand was meaningless.
Princess Mary replied, 'I have a letter from him.'
The prince glanced at Princess Mary with timid surprise.
The prince asked, 'Where is he?'
Princess Mary answered, 'He’s with the army, Father, at Smolénsk.'
The prince closed his eyes.
The prince remained silent for a long time.
The prince nodded his head and reopened his eyes.
The prince said, 'Yes,' softly and distinctly.
The prince said, 'Russia has perished.'
The prince said, 'They’ve destroyed her.'
The prince began to sob.
Princess Mary could no longer restrain herself and wept.
Princess Mary gazed at the prince's face.
The prince closed his eyes again.
The prince's sobs ceased.
The prince pointed to his eyes.
Tíkhon understood the prince.
Tíkhon wiped away the prince's tears.
The prince opened his eyes again.
The prince said something none of them could understand for a long time.
Tíkhon understood the prince's words.
Tíkhon repeated the prince's words.
Princess Mary had sought the meaning of the prince's words.
Princess Mary thought the prince was speaking of Russia.
Princess Mary thought the prince was speaking of Prince Andrew.
Princess Mary thought the prince was speaking of herself.
Princess Mary thought the prince was speaking of his grandson.
Princess Mary thought the prince was speaking of his own death.
